metadata.Title: CVE-2023-27561 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
runc through 1.1.4 has Incorrect Access Control leading to Escalation of Privileges, related to libcontainer/rootfs_linux.go. To exploit this, an attacker must be able to spawn two containers with custom volume-mount configurations, and be able to run custom images. NOTE: this issue exists because of a CVE-2019-19921 regression.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-27561` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

runc - 1.0.0~rc7+git20190403.029124da-0ubuntu1~16.04.4+esm4
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: runc package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.0~rc7+git20190403.029124da-0ubuntu1~16.04.4+esm4').
